FuncDef:
The mac-address phy-port synchronize enable command enables immediate MAC address synchronization on physical interfaces.
The undo mac-address phy-port synchronize command disables this function.
By default, immediate MAC address synchronization is disabled on physical interfaces.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
By default, MAC addresses are not synchronized on physical interfaces. If a device has both logical and physical interfaces and the outbound interface for uplink traffic with the same source MAC address alternates between an Eth-Trunk interface (a logical interface) and a physical interface, the physical interface cannot learn correct MAC address entries, resulting in a traffic forwarding failure. To resolve this problem, run the mac-address phy-port synchronize enable command to enable immediate MAC address synchronization on physical interfaces.
Configuration Impact
After this command is configured, if a Layer 2 loop occurs, there is a possibility that CPU usage is high. You can enable MAC flapping-based loop detection to prevent high CPU usage.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
